thread.title: Forex reserves up $631.5 million to $352.02 billion
thread.title_full: Forex reserves up $631.5 million to $352.02 billion

title: Forex reserves up $631.5 million to $352.02 billion
text: Forex reserves up $631.5 million to $352.02 billion By PTI | 25 Sep, 2015, 06.06PM IST Country's foreign exchange reserves rose by $631.5 million to $352.02 billion in the week to September 18 due to rise in foreign currency assets, according to RBI data. Editor's Pick MUMBAI: Country's foreign exchange reserves rose by $631.5 million to $352.02 billion in the week to September 18 due to rise in foreign currency assets, according to RBI data. In the previous week, the reserves had jumped by a healthy $2.358 billion to $351.389 billion. Foreign currency assets (FCAs), a major component of overall reserves, grew by $592.7 million to $328.560 billion in the reporting week, the RBI said in a statement. FCAs, expressed in dollar terms, include the effect of appreciation and depreciation of non-US currencies such as the euro, pound and the yen, held in the reserves. The gold reserves remained unchanged at $18.035 billion. India's special drawing rights with the International Monetary Fund jumped by $29.3 million to touch $4.097 billion in the week under review, while the nation's reserve position with the Fund rose by $9.5 million to $1.328 billion, the apex bank said.
